title: Relates to notice upon conviction for certain violations of right to withdraw consent
summary: Relates to notice upon conviction for certain violations of right to withdraw consent.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1419

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                    January 7, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen.  SALAND -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Transportation

       AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation  to  notice  to
         guardians of minors holding learner's permits or junior licenses, upon
         conviction for certain violations, of their right to withdraw consent

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 5 of section 514 of  the  vehicle  and  traffic
    2  law,  as amended by chapter 1097 of the laws of 1971, is amended to read
    3  as follows:
    4    [S] 5. Upon the conviction of any person under eighteen years  of  age
    5  who  resides  within  the household of his parent or guardian, the trial
    6  court  or  clerk  shall  forthwith  transmit  written  notice  of   such
    7  conviction  to  the  parent  or  guardian of such minor person AND SHALL
    8  PROVIDE SUCH PARENT OR GUARDIAN WITH A  SUMMARY  OF  THE  PROVISIONS  OF
    9  PARAGRAPH  (D)  OF  SUBDIVISION  TWO OF SECTION FIVE HUNDRED TWO OF THIS
   10  TITLE AUTHORIZING SUCH PARENT OR GUARDIAN TO WITHDRAW THEIR  CONSENT  TO
   11  THE  ISSUANCE  OR  REISSUANCE  OF SUCH LICENSE OR LEARNER'S PERMIT. SUCH
   12  NOTICE SHALL INFORM THE PARENT OR GUARDIAN OF  ANY  ACTION  TAKEN  AS  A
   13  RESULT  OF  THE CONVICTION AND SHALL PROVIDE A FORM ON WHICH PARENTS MAY
   14  NOTIFY THE  DEPARTMENT  OF  THEIR  INTENT  TO  WITHDRAW  THEIR  CONSENT;
   15  provided,  however,  that transmittal of such notice of conviction shall
   16  not be required in any case in  which  notice  of  arraignment  of  such
   17  person upon the charge or charges of which convicted is required by, and
   18  shall  have  been previously transmitted as provided in, subdivision two
   19  of section eighteen hundred seven of this chapter.
   20    S 2. This act shall take effect nine months after it shall have become
   21  a law.


        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
